scenes.brief: Old Hu's search party finds the missing women in a strange part of the forest, where they claim to have seen ghosts.
scenes.original_text: I released the hunting dog, and it darted out like an arrow, with all of us following closely behind. Underneath a large pine tree, we found three missing women. The girls, Bai Ling and Gui Lan, were holding onto the second daughter-in-law of the Wang family, at a loss of what to do. Bai Ling told me, 'Brother Hu, then you guys came along. It scared us to death. It's broad daylight, and we saw ghosts.'

scenes.brief: Investigating the spot where the women saw 'ghosts', Fatty trips over a bone, leading to the discovery of a shallow mass grave of laborers.
scenes.original_text: Not far along, Fatty tripped and fell flat on his face. Cursing, he got up, thinking he had stumbled over a tree root, but a touch revealed it felt unlike one. Bringing it closer for inspection, he instantly dropped it in shock, exclaiming, 'My God, a human thigh!' I sent two men to escort Bai Ling and her sisters back, then led the remaining few to dig up the soil with the butt of our hunting rifles. We didn't have to dig far before uncovering a mass of human bones.

scenes.brief: Old Hu identifies a sinister feng shui formation of dead locust trees trapping the spirits and leads the group to burn the trees to free the souls.
scenes.original_text: I quickly surveyed the locust trees in the vicinity—all dead, seven in total, arranged in the pattern of the Big Dipper's sweeping tail. According to the Sixteen-Character Yin-Yang Feng Shui Secret Technique, one of the sixteen characters strictly prohibits the presence of dead locust, willow, or poplar trees around a grave. I explained the situation to the Branch Secretary, urging that we cut down these dead locust trees at once. In the time it took to finish a meal, all seven ancient locusts were felled. Flames soared high, and the dry wood crackled strangely, emitting plumes of black smoke.

scenes.brief: The group breaks into the underground fortress, discovering immense stockpiles of Japanese weapons and supplies, which they begin to transport.
scenes.original_text: At the iron doors of the Gena Warehouse, the signs of a struggle were evident. Inside, we were all dumbstruck: row upon row of artillery pieces, like mountain guns, field howitzers, Type 60 Cannons, mortars of various sizes, and ammunition boxes piled up like mountains. The supplies from the Underground Fortress took an entire day to move, and we had barely scratched the surface. At dinner, the Branch Secretary approached me with a concern. He suggested burying the entrance to the Fortress and having everyone return to the village, to resume the work the following spring.

scenes.brief: Upon returning to the village, the group is devastated to learn that a landslide at the Ox Heart Mountain archaeological site has killed the team, including relatives of the villagers.
scenes.original_text: Stepping outside, we saw the Branch Secretary going from door to door, banging on them and calling people out: 'This is terrible! There's been a landslide on Ox Heart Mountain, and the archaeological team is trapped inside.' It turned out that within the ancient tomb's underground palace on Ox Heart Mountain, layer upon layer was revealed. Eleven members of the archaeological team who were inside clearing the tomb master's coffin were buried within. The leaders from the banner arrived and, seeing the situation, knew there was no hope.

scenes.brief: Old Hu and Fatty return to Beijing and meet Big Gold Tooth to have their jade bi appraised.
scenes.original_text: Upon disembarking from the train, we didn't go anywhere else but headed straight for Panjiayuan. Big Gold Tooth was just as before, insufferably vulgar with a mercenary air about him. The moment Big Gold Tooth spotted us, he quickly set aside his business and bombarded us with questions. Big Gold Tooth quickly signaled to us with his eyes, hinting not to take out the items: 'Let's head to Dongsi instead. That restaurant where we had the mutton hotpot last time is quite nice and quiet.'

scenes.brief: Big Gold Tooth identifies the artifact as a 'Moth-bodied Chi-patterned Double Dagger-shaped Bi' worth a significant sum, and they discuss future tomb raiding plans.
scenes.original_text: I then asked Fatty to take out the jade bi and show it to Big Gold Tooth. Big Gold Tooth examined it meticulously, occasionally bringing it to his nose to sniff and even licking it with his tongue. 'It's called a moth-bodied, chi-patterned, double dagger-shaped bi,' he explained. 'For these two burial objects, I'll give you a baseline estimate. Based solely on their own merit, they would be valued between forty and fifty thousand yuan in the domestic market.'
